objectives: Learn names for family members and people in our village.
Understand how different family members are related.
Practice using words to describe what people look like and their nature.

sections.text: These are the people who live with us in our home every day. They are very close to us.

examples.label: Father
examples.value: Your father is your male parent. He often works to earn money for the family and takes care of everyone. In our village, many fathers are farmers.

examples.label: Mother
examples.value: Your mother is your female parent. She takes care of the home, cooks food, and looks after the children. Many mothers in our village are also homemakers or work in the fields.

examples.label: Brother
examples.value: Your brother is a boy who has the same parents as you. He can be older (elder brother) or younger (younger brother).

examples.label: Sister
examples.value: Your sister is a girl who has the same parents as you. She can be older (elder sister) or younger (younger sister).

examples.label: Parents
examples.value: This is the word for your father and mother together.

examples.label: Siblings
examples.value: This word means your brothers and sisters together. [6, 33]

examples.label: Husband
examples.value: A husband is a married man. Your mother's spouse is your father.

examples.label: Wife
examples.value: A wife is a married woman. Your father's spouse is your mother.

examples.label: Spouse
examples.value: This is a general term for a husband or wife. [15]

examples.label: Son
examples.value: A son is a male child.

examples.label: Daughter
examples.value: A daughter is a female child.

examples.label: Children
examples.value: This is the word for sons and daughters together.

usage_examples: My father goes to the farm early in the morning.
My mother cooks delicious food for our family.
My elder brother helps me with my homework every evening.
My younger sister loves to play with her dolls.
My father teaches me how to ride a bicycle.
My mother tells us bedtime stories every night.
My brother and I go to the same school.
My sister has long, black hair.
Our father is very strong.
My mother helps me prepare for my exams.
My elder brother studies in class 10.
My younger sister draws beautiful pictures.
My parents work together on the farm.
I have two siblings, one brother and one sister.
My mother's husband is my father.
My uncle's wife is my aunt.
A good spouse is a good partner in life. [2]
His son is a doctor in the city.
Their daughter is a teacher in the village school.
The parents love their children very much.

sections.text: These are other relatives who are part of our family, like our parents' parents or brothers and sisters. They are also important.

examples.label: Grandfather
examples.value: Your grandfather is the father of your father or mother. He is often the oldest male member of the family, and we learn many stories from him.

examples.label: Grandmother
examples.value: Your grandmother is the mother of your father or mother. She often tells us stories, teaches us traditions, and cares for us with much love.

examples.label: Uncle
examples.value: Your uncle is your father's brother or your mother's brother. He can also be the husband of your aunt. He is your father's or mother's male sibling.

examples.label: Aunt
examples.value: Your aunt is your father's sister or your mother's sister. She can also be the wife of your uncle. She is your father's or mother's female sibling.

examples.label: Cousin
examples.value: Your cousin is the child of your uncle or aunt. Cousins are like brothers and sisters, but they have different parents.

examples.label: Nephew
examples.value: Your nephew is the son of your brother or sister.

examples.label: Niece
examples.value: Your niece is the daughter of your brother or sister.

examples.label: Grandparents
examples.value: This is the word for your grandfather and grandmother together.

examples.label: Great-grandfather
examples.value: The father of your grandfather or grandmother.

examples.label: Great-grandmother
examples.value: The mother of your grandfather or grandmother.

examples.label: Relative
examples.value: A person connected to you by blood or marriage. All your family members are your relatives. [28]

usage_examples: My grandfather takes me to the village market every Sunday.
My grandmother sings traditional songs for us.
My uncle owns a small shop in the village.
My aunt makes delicious sweets during festivals.
My cousin, Ravi, lives in the next village.
We visit our grandparents during the summer holidays.
My grandmother tells me stories about when she was young.
My uncle helped us build a new fence for our farm.
My aunt always gives me new clothes for Diwali.
My cousins and I play cricket in the fields.
My grandfather enjoys sitting under the big tree.
My grandmother teaches me how to knit sweaters.
My uncle is a very kind person.
My aunt brings us fresh milk from her cows.
I share my toys with my cousins when they visit.
My brother's son is my little nephew.
My sister's daughter is my beautiful niece.
All our relatives came for the wedding.

sections.text: Understanding how family members are connected helps us talk about our relatives more easily.

table.title: Family Relationships
rows: My elder brother goes to college.
Brother of your father/mother, or husband of aunt
My uncle runs a small shop.
Sister of your father/mother, or wife of uncle
My cousin is my best friend.
My nephew is five years old.
My niece loves to read books.
Her spouse works in the city.

sections.text: In our village, many people do different jobs to help everyone. They are called community helpers.

examples.label: Farmer
examples.value: A farmer is a person who grows crops like wheat, rice, or vegetables and raises animals like cows and goats. Farmers work hard in the fields to provide food for all of us.

examples.label: Shopkeeper
examples.value: A shopkeeper is a person who owns or works in a shop. They sell different things like food, clothes, or household items that people need every day.

examples.label: Teacher
examples.value: A teacher is a person who teaches students in a school. They help us learn new subjects, read, write, and understand the world around us.

examples.label: Doctor
examples.value: A doctor is a person who treats sick people and helps them get well. They examine patients, give medicines, and provide advice on staying healthy.

examples.label: Postman
examples.value: A postman is a person who delivers letters, postcards, and parcels to our homes. They work for the post office and help us send and receive messages.

examples.label: Milkman
examples.value: A milkman is a person who delivers fresh milk to homes and shops. In our village, they often bring milk from their own cows or buffaloes.

examples.label: Carpenter
examples.value: A carpenter makes and repairs wooden objects and structures, like tables, chairs, and doors.

examples.label: Potter
examples.value: A potter makes pots, bowls, and other items from clay.

examples.label: Blacksmith
examples.value: A blacksmith makes and repairs things made of iron, like farming tools.

examples.label: Tailor
examples.value: A tailor stitches and alters clothes like shirts, pants, and blouses.

examples.label: Weaver
examples.value: A weaver makes cloth by weaving threads together on a loom.

examples.label: Cobbler
examples.value: A cobbler mends shoes and sandals.

examples.label: Barber
examples.value: A barber cuts hair and shaves beards.

usage_examples: My father is a farmer; he grows rice in his field.
The shopkeeper at the village store sells fresh vegetables.
Our English teacher teaches us new words every day.
The doctor in our village dispensary helps sick children.
The postman brings letters from my relatives in the city.
The milkman delivers fresh milk to our house every morning.
A carpenter made a new wooden door for our house.
The potter sells beautiful clay pots at the market.
The blacksmith is fixing the plough for the farmer.
My mother gave her saree to the tailor for stitching.
The weaver in our village makes colorful shawls.
I took my broken sandal to the cobbler.
My brother goes to the barber for a haircut every month.

sections.text: These people have special roles in managing the village or helping with religious activities.

examples.label: Sarpanch
examples.value: The Sarpanch is the head of the village panchayat (council). They are chosen by the villagers and help solve village problems, manage development work, and ensure peace.

examples.label: Priest / Pandit / Maulvi
examples.value: A priest, pandit (Hindu), or maulvi (Muslim) is a person who leads religious ceremonies and prayers in temples or mosques. They also give spiritual guidance to the community. [23]

examples.label: Neighbor
examples.value: A neighbor is a person who lives very close to your house, in the same street or village. Good neighbors help each other in times of need.

examples.label: Mason
examples.value: A mason builds houses and other structures with bricks, stones, and cement.

examples.label: Electrician
examples.value: An electrician installs and repairs electrical wiring and fixtures.

examples.label: Plumber
examples.value: A plumber installs and repairs pipes and taps for water.

examples.label: Mechanic
examples.value: A mechanic repairs machines, especially vehicles like tractors and motorcycles.

examples.label: Driver
examples.value: A driver operates a vehicle like a bus, car, or tractor.

examples.label: Guard
examples.value: A guard protects a place, like a school or a bank, from danger.

examples.label: Sweeper
examples.value: A sweeper cleans the streets and public places in the village.

examples.label: Elder
examples.value: An elder is an old and respected person in the village who often gives advice. [19]

usage_examples: The Sarpanch called a meeting to discuss the new road construction in our village.
Our Sarpanch listens to everyone's problems carefully.
The Pandit performs pujas in the village temple every morning.
The Maulvi leads the prayers in the village mosque.
My neighbor, Uncle Ram, always shares fresh vegetables from his garden.
The mason is building a new wall for the school.
We called the electrician to fix the fan.
The plumber repaired the leaking tap in our kitchen.
The mechanic fixed my father's tractor.
The bus driver takes us to the city.
The night guard keeps our village safe.
The sweeper works hard to keep our streets clean.
We should always listen to the advice of our elders.

sections.text: We use these words to talk about how a person looks on the outside, like their height or age. [7]

examples.label: Tall
examples.value: Someone who is tall has a greater height than average. For example, a basketball player is often tall.

examples.label: Short
examples.value: Someone who is short has a smaller height than average. A small child is short.

examples.label: Old
examples.value: Someone who is old has lived for many years. Our grandparents are usually old.

examples.label: Young
examples.value: Someone who is young has not lived for many years; they are in an early stage of life. Children are young.

examples.label: Strong
examples.value: Someone who is strong has a lot of physical power and can lift heavy things. A farmer who works hard is strong.

examples.label: Weak
examples.value: Someone who is weak does not have much physical power or energy. A sick person might feel weak.

examples.label: Beautiful
examples.value: Used to describe a woman or girl who is very pretty to look at.

examples.label: Handsome
examples.value: Used to describe a man or boy who is good-looking.

examples.label: Thin
examples.value: Someone who has very little fat on their body.

examples.label: Fat
examples.value: Someone who has a lot of fat on their body.

examples.label: Fair
examples.value: Having a light skin color.

examples.label: Dark
examples.value: Having a deep skin color.

examples.label: Curly Hair
examples.value: Hair that grows in curls or waves.

examples.label: Straight Hair
examples.value: Hair that does not bend or curl.

usage_examples: My elder brother is very tall, almost touching the door frame.
The little girl next door is short but very fast.
My grandfather is old, but he still walks to the temple every day.
All the students in class 6 are young and full of energy.
The farmer is strong; he carries heavy sacks of grain easily.
After the fever, I felt very weak for a few days.
The princess in the story was very beautiful.
The hero in the movie was tall and handsome.
He is very thin because he doesn't eat much.
My aunt is fair, but my uncle is dark.
My sister has long, curly hair.
The new teacher has short, straight hair.

table.title: Opposites in Physical Description
rows: He is tall. She is short.
My grandfather is old. My baby cousin is young.
The farmer is strong. The sick boy is weak.
The shopkeeper is fat. The boy is thin.
Her skin is fair. His skin is dark.
She has curly hair. He has straight hair.

sections.text: We use these words to talk about a person's inner qualities and how they behave towards others. [24]

examples.label: Kind
examples.value: Someone who is kind is friendly, generous, and caring towards others. A kind person always helps others.

examples.label: Helpful
examples.value: Someone who is helpful likes to assist others and make things easier for them. Our teachers are always helpful.

examples.label: Honest
examples.value: Someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not lie or cheat. An honest person is trustworthy.

examples.label: Hardworking
examples.value: Someone who is hardworking puts a lot of effort and dedication into their tasks. Farmers are very hardworking.

examples.label: Friendly
examples.value: Someone who is friendly is pleasant, approachable, and easy to get along with. They like to talk and interact with others.

examples.label: Brave
examples.value: Someone who is not afraid of danger.

examples.label: Wise
examples.value: Someone who has good judgment and knowledge from experience.

examples.label: Cheerful
examples.value: Someone who is noticeably happy and optimistic.

examples.label: Quiet
examples.value: Someone who does not talk much.

examples.label: Polite
examples.value: Someone who has good manners and is respectful to others.

examples.label: Clever
examples.value: Someone who is intelligent and quick to learn.

examples.label: Lazy
examples.value: Someone who does not like to work or be active.

usage_examples: Our principal is a very kind person; he listens to all our problems.
My elder sister is helpful; she always assists me with my studies.
The shopkeeper is honest; he never cheats anyone.
My father is hardworking; he works in the fields from morning till evening.
My new classmate is very friendly and likes to play with everyone.
The soldier was very brave.
My grandfather is a wise man.
She has a very cheerful nature.
He is a quiet boy who likes to read books.
It is important to be polite to elders.
The clever student solved the problem quickly.
The lazy boy did not finish his homework.

sections.text: These are the different areas and parts that make up a home.

examples.label: House
examples.value: A building where people live.

examples.label: Home
examples.value: The place where you live with your family.

examples.label: Room
examples.value: A separate space within a house, like a bedroom or kitchen.

examples.label: Door
examples.value: An opening in a wall that you use to enter or leave a room or house.

examples.label: Window
examples.value: An opening in a wall, usually with glass, that lets in light and air.

examples.label: Roof
examples.value: The cover on the top of a house.

examples.label: Wall
examples.value: The sides of a room or building.

examples.label: Floor
examples.value: The surface you walk on inside a house.

examples.label: Kitchen
examples.value: The room where food is cooked.

examples.label: Bedroom
examples.value: The room where you sleep.

examples.label: Bathroom
examples.value: The room with a toilet and a place to wash.

examples.label: Living Room
examples.value: The room where the family relaxes and meets guests.

examples.label: Courtyard
examples.value: An open space surrounded by the walls of a house.

examples.label: Veranda
examples.value: A covered area along the outside of a house.

examples.label: Stairs
examples.value: A set of steps to go from one floor to another.

usage_examples: Our house is painted yellow.
There is no place like home.
My house has four rooms.
Please close the door.
Open the window to let in fresh air.
The roof of our house is made of tin.
There is a clock on the wall.
The floor is clean.
My mother is cooking in the kitchen.
I sleep in my bedroom.
Please wash your hands in the bathroom.
We watch television in the living room.
The children are playing in the courtyard.
My grandfather sits on the veranda in the evening.
Be careful when you walk down the stairs.

sections.text: These are common objects you find inside a home.

examples.label: Bed
examples.value: A piece of furniture used for sleeping.

examples.label: Chair
examples.value: A seat for one person, with a back and four legs.

examples.label: Table
examples.value: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs.

examples.label: Stove
examples.value: A piece of equipment used for cooking food.

examples.label: Utensils
examples.value: Tools used for cooking or eating, like spoons and pots.

examples.label: Pot
examples.value: A round container used for cooking.

examples.label: Plate
examples.value: A flat dish from which food is eaten.

examples.label: Cup
examples.value: A small bowl-shaped container for drinking.

examples.label: Glass
examples.value: A container made of glass for drinking water.

examples.label: Spoon
examples.value: A utensil with a small bowl at the end, used for eating.

examples.label: Knife
examples.value: A tool with a blade for cutting.

examples.label: Lamp
examples.value: A device that produces light.

examples.label: Mat
examples.value: A piece of material placed on the floor.

examples.label: Blanket
examples.value: A warm covering used on a bed.

examples.label: Pillow
examples.value: A cushion to support the head while sleeping.

examples.label: Cupboard
examples.value: A piece of furniture with shelves for storing things.

examples.label: Box
examples.value: A container with a flat base and sides, typically square or rectangular.

examples.label: Mirror
examples.value: A surface that reflects an image.

examples.label: Clock
examples.value: An instrument that shows the time.

examples.label: Broom
examples.value: A brush with a long handle, used for sweeping the floor.

usage_examples: I go to bed at 9 p.m.
Please sit on the chair.
Keep the book on the table.
Mother is cooking rice on the stove.
Wash the utensils after eating.
There is water in the pot.
I eat food from a plate.
I drink tea in a cup.
Please give me a glass of water.
We eat with a spoon.
Be careful with the knife.
Switch on the lamp, it is dark.
We sit on a mat on the floor.
It is cold, I need a blanket.
My pillow is very soft.
Keep your clothes in the cupboard.
There is a box full of old toys.
I see my face in the mirror.
The clock on the wall shows it is 10 o'clock.
My sister is sweeping the floor with a broom.

sections.text: These are the common locations and areas you can find in a village.

examples.label: Village
examples.value: A small community of houses in a rural area. [20]

examples.label: Street
examples.value: A public road in a village or town.

examples.label: Lane
examples.value: A narrow road or street.

examples.label: Market
examples.value: A place where people buy and sell goods.

examples.label: Shop
examples.value: A place where things are sold.

examples.label: School
examples.value: A place where children go to learn. [20]

examples.label: Temple
examples.value: A building for worship in the Hindu religion.

examples.label: Mosque
examples.value: A building for worship in the Islamic religion.

examples.label: Church
examples.value: A building for worship in the Christian religion. [20]

examples.label: Well
examples.value: A deep hole in the ground to get water.

examples.label: Pond
examples.value: A small area of still water.

examples.label: River
examples.value: A large natural stream of water.

examples.label: Field
examples.value: An area of open land, especially one planted with crops.

examples.label: Farm
examples.value: An area of land used for growing crops or raising animals.

examples.label: Path
examples.value: A way made across the land for people to walk along.

usage_examples: Our village is small and beautiful.
Children are playing on the street.
My house is in the first lane.
We buy vegetables from the market.
My uncle has a sweet shop.
I go to the village school every day.
There is a big temple in our village.
People go to the mosque for prayers.
The church bell rings on Sunday.
We draw water from the well.
Ducks are swimming in the pond.
We bathe in the river.
The farmer is working in the field.
There are many cows on the farm.
Follow this path to reach the river.

sections.text: Words used to describe the qualities of things and places around us. [29]

examples.label: Big
examples.value: Large in size.

examples.label: Small
examples.value: Little in size.

examples.label: New
examples.value: Recently made or existing for a short time.

examples.label: Old
examples.value: Having existed for a long time.

examples.label: Clean
examples.value: Free from dirt or marks.

examples.label: Dirty
examples.value: Covered with dirt or not clean.

examples.label: Wet
examples.value: Covered or soaked with water.

examples.label: Dry
examples.value: Free from moisture or water.

examples.label: Hot
examples.value: Having a high temperature.

examples.label: Cold
examples.value: Having a low temperature.

examples.label: High
examples.value: Far above the ground.

examples.label: Low
examples.value: Close to the ground.

examples.label: Near
examples.value: At a short distance away.

examples.label: Far
examples.value: At a great distance away.

examples.label: Open
examples.value: Not closed or blocked.

examples.label: Closed
examples.value: Not open.

examples.label: Full
examples.value: Containing as much as possible.

examples.label: Empty
examples.value: Containing nothing.

examples.label: Heavy
examples.value: Having a lot of weight.

examples.label: Light
examples.value: Having little weight.

usage_examples: The elephant is a big animal.
The mouse is a small animal.
I have a new dress.
My grandfather has an old radio.
My room is very clean.
Your clothes are dirty.
My shirt is wet from the rain.
The clothes are now dry.
The tea is very hot.
The water is cold.
The bird is flying high in the sky.
The branch is hanging low.
My school is near my house.
The city is far from our village.
The shop is open.
The school is closed on Sunday.
The basket is full of fruits.
The box is empty.
This bag is very heavy.
This feather is very light.

sections.text: Words that describe how someone feels or the qualities of something.

examples.label: Happy
examples.value: Feeling or showing pleasure.

examples.label: Sad
examples.value: Feeling or showing sorrow or unhappiness.

examples.label: Angry
examples.value: Feeling or showing strong annoyance or displeasure.

examples.label: Scared
examples.value: Feeling fear or being frightened.

examples.label: Surprised
examples.value: Feeling of mild shock or amazement.

examples.label: Tired
examples.value: Feeling in need of rest or sleep.

examples.label: Hungry
examples.value: Feeling a need to eat food.

examples.label: Thirsty
examples.value: Feeling a need to drink something.

examples.label: Good
examples.value: Of a high standard or quality.

examples.label: Bad
examples.value: Of a low standard or poor quality.

examples.label: Beautiful
examples.value: Pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically.

examples.label: Ugly
examples.value: Unpleasant to look at.

examples.label: Bright
examples.value: Giving out or reflecting a lot of light.

examples.label: Dark
examples.value: With little or no light.

examples.label: Noisy
examples.value: Making a lot of noise.

usage_examples: I am very happy today.
The boy was sad because he lost his toy.
My father was angry when I broke the cup.
The child is scared of the dog.
She was surprised to see me.
After working all day, the farmer was tired.
I am hungry, I want to eat.
Can I have some water? I am thirsty.
He is a good student.
Lying is a bad habit.
The flower is beautiful.
The old house looked ugly.
The sun is very bright.
It is dark at night.
The market is a noisy place.

sections.text: Words that help us talk about the weather and time.

examples.label: Sunny
examples.value: With bright sunshine.

examples.label: Rainy
examples.value: When rain is falling.

examples.label: Cloudy
examples.value: When there are many clouds in the sky.

examples.label: Windy
examples.value: With a lot of wind.

examples.label: Day
examples.value: The period of light between sunrise and sunset.

examples.label: Night
examples.value: The period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.

examples.label: Morning
examples.value: The early part of the day, from sunrise to noon.

examples.label: Evening
examples.value: The later part of the day, from late afternoon until night.

examples.label: Today
examples.value: This present day.

examples.label: Yesterday
examples.value: The day before today.

examples.label: Tomorrow
examples.value: The day after today.

examples.label: Early
examples.value: Happening or done before the usual or expected time.

examples.label: Late
examples.value: Happening or done after the usual or expected time.

examples.label: Fast
examples.value: Moving or capable of moving at high speed.

examples.label: Slow
examples.value: Moving or capable of moving at a low speed.

usage_examples: It is a sunny day.
I like rainy days.
The sky is cloudy.
It is very windy today.
We work during the day.
We sleep at night.
I go to school in the morning.
I play in the evening.
Today is a holiday.
Yesterday was Sunday.
Tomorrow will be Tuesday.
The farmer wakes up early.
The bus was late today.
The horse runs very fast.
The turtle is very slow.

sections.text: Common verbs describing activities we do in our homes. [9]

examples.label: Eat
examples.value: To put food into the mouth and chew and swallow it. [8]

examples.label: Drink
examples.value: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow it. [8]

examples.label: Sleep
examples.value: To rest with your eyes closed and your mind and body inactive. [8]

examples.label: Wake up
examples.value: To stop sleeping.

examples.label: Cook
examples.value: To prepare food by using heat. [8]

examples.label: Clean
examples.value: To make something free from dirt. [25]

examples.label: Wash
examples.value: To clean something with water and soap. [8]

examples.label: Sit
examples.value: To be in a position with your body resting on your bottom.

examples.label: Stand
examples.value: To be in an upright position on your feet.

examples.label: Read
examples.value: To look at and understand the meaning of written words. [8]

examples.label: Write
examples.value: To mark letters or words on a surface with a pen or pencil. [8]

examples.label: Play
examples.value: To engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation. [8]

examples.label: Talk
examples.value: To speak in order to give information or express ideas.

examples.label: Listen
examples.value: To give attention to a sound.

examples.label: Rest
examples.value: To stop work or activity to relax or sleep.

usage_examples: We eat our dinner at 8 p.m.
I drink milk every morning.
The baby is sleeping.
I wake up at 6 a.m.
My mother will cook rice.
Please clean your room.
I need to wash my hands.
Please sit down.
Stand up when the teacher comes.
I like to read story books.
The students write in their notebooks.
The children play in the field.
My friend and I talk for hours.
Listen to what your parents say.
Let's rest for a while.

sections.text: Verbs describing activities common in a village setting.

examples.label: Walk
examples.value: To move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn.

examples.label: Run
examples.value: To walk very fast.

examples.label: Work
examples.value: To do a job, especially for money.

examples.label: Farm
examples.value: To use land for growing crops or raising animals.

examples.label: Sow
examples.value: To plant seeds in the ground.

examples.label: Reap
examples.value: To cut or gather a crop.

examples.label: Buy
examples.value: To get something by paying money for it. [8]

examples.label: Sell
examples.value: To give something to someone in exchange for money. [25]

examples.label: Go
examples.value: To move from one place to another.

examples.label: Come
examples.value: To move towards the speaker or a place.

examples.label: Meet
examples.value: To come together with someone.

examples.label: Help
examples.value: To make it easier for someone to do something.

examples.label: Teach
examples.value: To give lessons to a student in a school.

examples.label: Learn
examples.value: To gain knowledge or skill.

examples.label: Build
examples.value: To construct something by putting parts together.

usage_examples: I walk to school every day.
The children run in the park.
My father works in the field.
Many people in the village farm for a living.
The farmer will sow the seeds before the rain.
It is time to reap the harvest.
I will buy some sweets from the shop.
The shopkeeper will sell you rice.
I will go to the market.
Please come to my house.
I will meet my friend today.
We should help our neighbors.
The teacher will teach a new lesson.
We learn new things at school.
They will build a new house.

sections.text: Basic verbs that describe our interactions with the world.

examples.label: See
examples.value: To notice or become aware of with the eyes.

examples.label: Hear
examples.value: To perceive sound with the ears.

examples.label: Smell
examples.value: To perceive the odor of something with the nose. [8]

examples.label: Taste
examples.value: To perceive the flavor of something with the tongue.

examples.label: Touch
examples.value: To come into contact with something with your hand or skin.

examples.label: Give
examples.value: To freely transfer the possession of something to someone. [8]

examples.label: Take
examples.value: To get something into one's possession.

examples.label: Make
examples.value: To create or produce something.

examples.label: Do
examples.value: To perform an action or task.

examples.label: Bring
examples.value: To carry or take something to a place.

examples.label: Carry
examples.value: To support and move something from one place to another.

examples.label: Push
examples.value: To move something away from you. [25]

examples.label: Pull
examples.value: To move something towards you. [25]

examples.label: Open
examples.value: To move a door or window so that it is no longer closed.

examples.label: Close
examples.value: To move a door or window so that it is no longer open.

examples.label: Laugh
examples.value: To make the sounds that show you are happy or amused. [8]

examples.label: Cry
examples.value: To produce tears as an expression of sadness or pain. [8]

examples.label: Smile
examples.value: To form one's features into a pleased, kind, or amused expression.

examples.label: Think
examples.value: To have a particular idea or opinion. [8]

examples.label: Ask
examples.value: To say something in order to get an answer or information.

usage_examples: I can see a bird in the tree.
Can you hear the music?
I can smell the flowers.
The mango tastes sweet.
Don't touch the fire.
Please give me a pen.
Take this book with you.
My mother can make delicious cakes.
What are you doing?
Please bring me a glass of water.
He can carry the heavy box.
Push the door to open it.
Pull the rope.
Open your book.
Close the window.
The joke made me laugh.
The baby started to cry.
She has a beautiful smile.
I think it will rain today.
If you don't know, ask the teacher.

sections.text: Words for people who have positions of leadership or authority in a village or community. [10]

examples.label: Sarpanch
examples.value: The elected head of a village council (Panchayat).

examples.label: Panchayat Member
examples.value: A member of the village council.

examples.label: Village Headman
examples.value: A traditional leader of the village, often an elder.

examples.label: Elder
examples.value: A respected older person in the community. [19]

examples.label: Leader
examples.value: A person who guides or directs a group. [13]

examples.label: Officer
examples.value: A person holding a position of authority, like a police officer or government officer.

examples.label: Guard
examples.value: A person who protects a place or people.

examples.label: Judge
examples.value: A public official who decides cases in a court of law.

examples.label: Representative
examples.value: A person chosen to speak or act for others.

examples.label: Chief
examples.value: The leader of a tribe or clan.

usage_examples: The Sarpanch inaugurated the new school building.
He is a Panchayat Member and works for the village.
The village headman resolved the dispute peacefully.
We must respect the elders of our village.
A good leader listens to everyone.
The forest officer visited our village.
The security guard is at the bank's gate.
The judge announced the decision.
Our elected representative works for our area's development.
The tribal chief is a respected figure.

sections.text: Words for people based on their job or profession. [23]

examples.label: Farmer
examples.value: A person who cultivates land or raises livestock.

examples.label: Teacher
examples.value: A person who teaches, especially in a school.

examples.label: Doctor
examples.value: A qualified practitioner of medicine.

examples.label: Shopkeeper
examples.value: A person who owns or manages a shop.

examples.label: Postman
examples.value: A person who delivers mail.

examples.label: Milkman
examples.value: A person who sells or delivers milk.

examples.label: Carpenter
examples.value: A person who makes and repairs wooden objects.

examples.label: Potter
examples.value: A person who makes pottery.

examples.label: Blacksmith
examples.value: A person who forges iron.

examples.label: Tailor
examples.value: A person whose occupation is making or altering clothes.

examples.label: Weaver
examples.value: A person who weaves fabric.

examples.label: Cobbler
examples.value: A person who mends shoes.

examples.label: Barber
examples.value: A person who cuts hair.

examples.label: Mason
examples.value: A builder and worker in stone or brick.

examples.label: Mechanic
examples.value: A person who repairs and maintains machinery.

examples.label: Driver
examples.value: A person who drives a vehicle.

examples.label: Merchant
examples.value: A person involved in wholesale trade.

examples.label: Vendor
examples.value: A person who sells things, often in the street.

examples.label: Priest
examples.value: A religious leader.

examples.label: Artist
examples.value: A person who creates art, like paintings or sculptures.

usage_examples: The farmer is ploughing the field.
The teacher is writing on the blackboard.
The doctor is checking the patient.
The shopkeeper is weighing sugar.
The postman delivered a letter.
The milkman brings fresh milk.
The carpenter is making a table.
The potter is shaping a pot on the wheel.
The blacksmith is heating iron.
The tailor is stitching a shirt.
The weaver is working on a loom.
The cobbler fixed my shoe.
The barber gave my father a shave.
The mason is building a wall.
The mechanic repaired the water pump.
The bus driver is very careful.
The grain merchant has a big shop.
The vegetable vendor sells fresh produce.
The priest performed the ceremony.
The artist painted a beautiful picture of the village.

sections.text: Words that describe a person's position in a family or society. [16]

examples.label: Head of Family
examples.value: The person who is the leader of the family, often the eldest male. [15]

examples.label: Parent
examples.value: A father or mother. [15]

examples.label: Child
examples.value: A son or daughter.

examples.label: Sibling
examples.value: A brother or sister. [6]

examples.label: Elder
examples.value: An older person, respected for their age and wisdom.

examples.label: Youth
examples.value: Young people.

examples.label: Neighbor
examples.value: A person living next door or very near.

examples.label: Friend
examples.value: A person you know well and like.

examples.label: Guest
examples.value: A person who is invited to visit or stay in someone's home.

examples.label: Host
examples.value: A person who receives or entertains guests.

examples.label: Villager
examples.value: An inhabitant of a village.

examples.label: Citizen
examples.value: A legal inhabitant of a country. [13]

examples.label: Member
examples.value: A person who belongs to a group or organization. [13]

examples.label: Owner
examples.value: A person who owns something.

examples.label: Worker
examples.value: A person who does a particular job.

examples.label: Student
examples.value: A person who is studying at a school or college.

examples.label: Master
examples.value: A person who has people working for them, or is skilled in a craft.

examples.label: Servant
examples.value: A person who performs duties for others in a household.

examples.label: Helper
examples.value: A person who helps someone else.

examples.label: Patient
examples.value: A person receiving medical treatment.

usage_examples: My grandfather is the head of our family.
Every parent wants the best for their child.
She is the youngest child in the family.
He has three siblings.
We should take care of the elders in our community.
The youth of the village organized a cleaning drive.
Our neighbor is very helpful.
Raju is my best friend.
We have a guest coming for dinner.
The host welcomed us warmly.
Every villager participated in the festival.
It is our duty as a citizen to keep our country clean.
He is a member of the village sports club.
He is the owner of the big shop.
The farm worker is taking a rest.
I am a student of class 5.
The master craftsman taught his apprentice.
In old stories, kings had many servants.
My mother's helper assists her with chores.
The doctor is attending to the patient.

sections.text: Terms for your closest family members.

examples.label: Father
examples.value: Your male parent.

examples.label: Mother
examples.value: Your female parent.

examples.label: Son
examples.value: Your male child.

examples.label: Daughter
examples.value: Your female child.

examples.label: Brother
examples.value: A male with the same parents as you.

examples.label: Sister
examples.value: A female with the same parents as you.

examples.label: Parents
examples.value: Your father and mother together.

examples.label: Children
examples.value: Your sons and daughters together.

examples.label: Siblings
examples.value: Your brothers and sisters together.

examples.label: Spouse
examples.value: Your husband or wife.

examples.label: Husband
examples.value: The man you are married to.

examples.label: Wife
examples.value: The woman you are married to.

usage_examples: My father is a farmer.
My mother is a homemaker.
Their son works in a bank.
Their daughter is a nurse.
My brother is older than me.
My sister is younger than me.
Children should obey their parents.
The couple has two children.
Do you have any siblings?
She lives with her spouse and children.
Her husband is a teacher.
His wife is a doctor.

sections.text: Terms for relatives who are not in your immediate family. [19]

examples.label: Grandfather
examples.value: The father of your father or mother.

examples.label: Grandmother
examples.value: The mother of your father or mother.

examples.label: Grandson
examples.value: The son of your child.

examples.label: Granddaughter
examples.value: The daughter of your child.

examples.label: Uncle
examples.value: The brother of your father or mother.

examples.label: Aunt
examples.value: The sister of your father or mother.

examples.label: Cousin
examples.value: The child of your uncle or aunt.

examples.label: Nephew
examples.value: The son of your brother or sister. [6]

examples.label: Niece
examples.value: The daughter of your brother or sister. [6]

examples.label: Grandparents
examples.value: The parents of your parents.

examples.label: Grandchildren
examples.value: The children of your children.

examples.label: Paternal
examples.value: Related through the father. [31]

examples.label: Maternal
examples.value: Related through the mother. [31]

examples.label: Great-grandfather
examples.value: The father of your grandparent.

examples.label: Great-grandmother
examples.value: The mother of your grandparent.

examples.label: Ancestor
examples.value: A person in your family who lived a long time ago. [6]

examples.label: Descendant
examples.value: A person who is related to someone from the past. [6]

examples.label: Relative
examples.value: A member of your family. [28]

examples.label: Kin
examples.value: Your family and relatives.

examples.label: Family Tree
examples.value: A diagram showing family relationships. [6]

usage_examples: My paternal grandfather was a soldier.
My maternal grandmother lives with us.
The old man was happy to see his grandson.
He gave a gift to his granddaughter.
My uncle from the city is visiting us.
My aunt is very kind.
I am playing with my cousin.
He took his nephew to the fair.
She loves her niece very much.
My grandparents live in the village.
The old couple loves their grandchildren.
These are my paternal relatives.
My maternal uncle is a doctor.
My great-grandfather built this house.
My great-grandmother told me many stories.
Our ancestors came from this village.
He is a descendant of the village founder.
We invited all our relatives to the wedding.
All his kin gathered for the celebration.
I made a family tree for my school project.

sections.text: Terms for relationships through marriage and other social connections. [15]

examples.label: Father-in-law
examples.value: The father of your spouse.

examples.label: Mother-in-law
examples.value: The mother of your spouse.

examples.label: Son-in-law
examples.value: The husband of your daughter.

examples.label: Daughter-in-law
examples.value: The wife of your son.

examples.label: Brother-in-law
examples.value: The brother of your spouse, or the husband of your sister.

examples.label: Sister-in-law
examples.value: The sister of your spouse, or the wife of your brother.

examples.label: Guardian
examples.value: A person who legally has the responsibility of looking after someone who cannot care for themselves. [19]

examples.label: Orphan
examples.value: A child whose parents are dead.

examples.label: Widow
examples.value: A woman whose husband has died. [6]

examples.label: Widower
examples.value: A man whose wife has died. [6]

examples.label: Friend
examples.value: A person you know well, like, and trust.

examples.label: Acquaintance
examples.value: A person you know but who is not a close friend. [3]

examples.label: Partner
examples.value: Your husband, wife, or the person you live with in a romantic relationship. [2, 3]

examples.label: Fianc
examples.value: The man to whom a woman is engaged to be married. [2, 6]

examples.label: Fiance
examples.value: The woman to whom a man is engaged to be married. [2, 6]

usage_examples: My father-in-law is a retired teacher.
My mother-in-law is a very good cook.
Her son-in-law is very respectful.
His daughter-in-law takes good care of him.
My brother-in-law lives in another village.
My sister-in-law is a nurse.
After his parents died, his uncle became his guardian.
The orphanage takes care of many orphans.
The old widow lives alone.
The widower never married again.
A true friend helps in times of need.
He is just a business acquaintance.
She and her partner run a small shop.
She introduced me to her fianc.
His fiance is very beautiful.

sections.text: The primary roles people have within a family unit living together.

examples.label: Head of Household
examples.value: The person who is considered the leader and main decision-maker of the family. [15]

examples.label: Breadwinner
examples.value: The family member who earns the money to support the family. [15, 19]

examples.label: Homemaker
examples.value: A person who manages the household and does not work outside the home. [19]

examples.label: Father
examples.value: A male parent.

examples.label: Mother
examples.value: A female parent.

examples.label: Husband
examples.value: A married man.

examples.label: Wife
examples.value: A married woman.

examples.label: Son
examples.value: A male child.

examples.label: Daughter
examples.value: A female child.

examples.label: Brother
examples.value: A male sibling.

examples.label: Sister
examples.value: A female sibling.

examples.label: Child
examples.value: A young person in the family.

examples.label: Parent
examples.value: A father or mother.

examples.label: Sibling
examples.value: A brother or sister. [6]

examples.label: Baby
examples.value: A very young child or infant.

usage_examples: The eldest brother became the head of the household.
My father is the sole breadwinner of our family.
My mother is a homemaker and takes care of us.
A father provides for his family.
A mother nurtures her children.
A good husband supports his wife.
The wife was managing the household chores.
Their son is very responsible.
Their daughter helps her mother.
The brother protected his younger sister.
The sister shared her toys.
Every child needs love and care.
It is a parent's duty to educate their children.
The siblings play together happily.
The baby is sleeping in the cradle.

sections.text: Extended family members who might live in the same house.

examples.label: Grandfather
examples.value: The father of one's father or mother.

examples.label: Grandmother
examples.value: The mother of one's father or mother.

examples.label: Uncle
examples.value: The brother of one's parent.

examples.label: Aunt
examples.value: The sister of one's parent.

examples.label: Cousin
examples.value: The child of one's uncle or aunt.

examples.label: Nephew
examples.value: The son of one's sibling.

examples.label: Niece
examples.value: The daughter of one's sibling.

examples.label: In-law
examples.value: A relative by marriage, like a mother-in-law or brother-in-law. [15]

examples.label: Lodger
examples.value: A person who pays rent to live in a room in someone's house.

examples.label: Guest
examples.value: A person visiting and staying temporarily in one's home.

usage_examples: Our grandfather lives with us.
My grandmother tells us stories every night.
My uncle is staying with us for a few days.
My aunt helps my mother in the kitchen.
My cousin from the city is visiting for the summer.
Her nephew stays with her during holidays.
His niece is a student in the local school.
My sister and her in-laws live together in a large house.
We have a lodger who rents our spare room.
We must be hospitable to our guests.

sections.text: Words describing the various duties and responsibilities within a household.

examples.label: Provider
examples.value: A person who provides money and resources for the family.

examples.label: Caregiver
examples.value: A person who takes care of a child or a sick person. [15, 19]

examples.label: Cook
examples.value: The person who prepares the meals.

examples.label: Cleaner
examples.value: The person responsible for cleaning the house.

examples.label: Guardian
examples.value: A person who protects and is responsible for a child. [19]

examples.label: Protector
examples.value: Someone who keeps the family safe from harm.

examples.label: Teacher (at home)
examples.value: A family member who helps children with their studies.

examples.label: Disciplinarian
examples.value: The person who enforces rules and discipline in the family. [15]

examples.label: Manager (of finances)
examples.value: The person who manages the family's money.

examples.label: Shopper
examples.value: The person who buys groceries and other household items.

examples.label: Repairperson
examples.value: Someone who fixes broken things in the house.

examples.label: Gardener
examples.value: The person who takes care of the garden.

examples.label: Storyteller
examples.value: The person, often a grandparent, who tells stories to the children.

examples.label: Decision-maker
examples.value: The person who makes important decisions for the family.

examples.label: Helper
examples.value: Someone who assists with various household tasks.

examples.label: Earner
examples.value: Someone who earns money for the family.

examples.label: Organizer
examples.value: The person who keeps the house and schedules in order.

examples.label: Nurturer
examples.value: Someone who provides love, care, and support.

examples.label: Elder
examples.value: The older, respected member whose advice is valued.

examples.label: Youth
examples.value: The young members of the household.

usage_examples: The father is often the main provider.
The mother is the primary caregiver for the children.
My aunt is the best cook in the family.
My sister acts as the cleaner on weekends.
An older sibling can be a guardian to the younger ones.
The father is seen as the protector of the family.
My elder brother is my teacher at home for math.
My father is the disciplinarian in our house.
My mother is the manager of our household finances.
My brother is the designated shopper for our family.
My father is the repairperson for small fixes at home.
My grandmother is an excellent gardener.
My grandfather is a great storyteller.
The head of the family is the main decision-maker.
Every child should be a helper at home.
Both parents are earners in their family.
My mother is a great organizer.
A mother is a natural nurturer.
We seek guidance from the family elder.
The youth bring energy and new ideas to the household.
